text: Reynaldo Rey (born Harry Reynolds; January 27, 1940 - May 28, 2015) was an American actor, comedian, and television personality. He started his career in 1973. He was best known for roles in the movies Harlem Nights (1989), White Men Can't Jump (1992), and Friday (1995). He also appeared in the television series 227. Rey was born in Sequoyah County, Oklahoma. He was of African American and Native American ancestry. Rey died from problems caused by a stroke on May 28, 2015 in Los Angeles, California. He was 75. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1940 deaths Category:2015 deaths Category:Actors from Oklahoma Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Deaths from stroke
title: Reynaldo Rey
